snippet: SwiftKey’s app for Android, which the London start-up made available free last week, is used on almost 250 million handsets. Now the company hopes to develop a relationship with Apple.
abstract: Android keyboard enhancement app developed by London start-up SwiftKey has been one of the most successful applications on Google's Play Store, and is now used on almost 250 million handsets worldwide; downloads have only increased in week since company made application free; SwiftKey is now working on similar app that will work across Apple smartphone software.
lead_paragraph: SwiftKey’s app for Android, which the London start-up made available free last week, is used on almost 250 million handsets. Now the company hopes to develop a relationship with Apple.

headline.main: A Smartphone Keyboard App That Anticipates What You Want to Type
headline.print_headline: A Smartphone Keyboard App That Anticipates What You Want to Type
